At Wed, 30 Jan 2008 08:37:52 -0800,
"Travis Jensen" <travis.jensen@sirsidyn=
ix.com> wrote:
> 
> I originally asked this question regarding 2.0RC1, but =
I didn't get
> any response. Given the sparse docs for 2.0, I'm backing up =
to 1.4.1
> and asking the same question:

1.4.1? There are newer releases i=
n the 1.x branch.
 
> I've got a set of seed URLs. Each of the URL has some=
 other
> meta-data (categorical) associated with it. What I want to do is
>=
 store each of the crawled URLs along with the meta-data associated
> with =
the seed URL.

So the essence is that you want to track the discovery path =
of a URL
back to a seed, and associate arbitrary metadata with a crawl or w=
ith
every URL that was discovered by a certain seed?

Tracking discovery pa=
th back to a seed might be possible but I do not
think that it is currently=
 implemented. Since Heritrix tracks the
discovery path from a seed to a URL=
 I think it might not be that
difficult to track the seed itself.

As for s=
toring metadata, Heritrix does not (as far as I know) concern
itself with a=
ny descriptive metadata about a crawl. This would either
need to be dealt w=
ith outside of Heritrix or added to Heritrix.

> Is it possible to keep tha=
t meta-data with the seed URL as the
> crawling progresses? Can I do it as =
a single job with many seeds or
> do I have to plan on creating a single jo=
b per "meta-data"? Where do
> I plug in to receive the content of the crawl=
ed page?
> 
> Any pointers are greatly appreciated.

What we do here at CDL=
 is have one job per site, where sites have
descriptive metadata (outside o=
f Heritrix) associated with them. This
is probably the easiest solution if =
you don=E2=80=99t want to modify Heritrix.

best,
Erik Hetzner
